Reviews.Title: “The place to be!”
Reviews.Author: marie88d
Reviews.Content: It was perfect! Very central location ,nice and devoted staff , clean and comfortable room, and delicious breakfast thanks to the sweet old woman...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet central hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Dima K
Reviews.Content: I've spent 5 days at hotel. Very good location in centre of Sultanahmet, near Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and other places. Situated in the backyards of the main street - it's very quite at night. Nice staff - especially very pleasant old woman in the kitchen. Rooms are cleaned every day. The linen are changed every 3 days. Rates are lower if you paying by cash than via Visa\MC Nice choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great for exploring the old city”
Reviews.Author: Ryan F
Reviews.Content: We chose this place for the location and it did not disappoint. I rode the LRT (metro) from the airport and was dropped just steps away from the hotel entrance (side note: if you arrive at rush hour and have a lot of baggage this may not be the best option for you). Its an easy walk to just about all the sites you'll want to see in old istanbul, and the hotel itself is charming inside and out. The mediterranean breakfast on the hotel rooftop was a nice surprise, such a nice way to start the day that we didn't want to leave in the morning. Highly recommended for tourists who like to be walking distance from the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and centrally located hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jens P
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a whole week (7 nights) at Hotel Atalntis with a group of history students form University College Capital - teacher training - Zahles seminarium, Denmark. The hotel is very centrally located in the historical centrum of Istanbul. All the big sights are in walking distance from the hotel. There are a lot of fine restaurants in the nabourhood. The hotel itself is a fine little hotel. It has a fine standard. The rooms were clean and with heating. The bathrooms were fine. Clean tovels everyday. Breakfast was delicious. The atmosphare was generally friendly. The staff was professional, friendly, helpful and very serviceminded, I can recommend the hotel to all others. Kind regards Jens Pietras Historian

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DubrovnikCroatia
Reviews.Content: I was a few times in Istanbul and this is my second time I stay in Hotel Atlantis. This time we were there for 7 nights. Hotel Atlantis is very central located, just a second far away from all the main attractions. It is very simple, basic, very very clean what is so important. Stuff if more than great, very kind & helpful. Nice breakfast. Great value for money!!!! and on the and when we left and when we came at the airport our flight was cancelled. It was midnight. I was socked. I just ring the hotel and ask for help and receptionist arrange transfer for us and also next morning again to the airport. Thank you so much for everything you have done to me. We will be back!!!! Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: LISA_from_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed there about 1 week in November and it was the worst time!The room was very small and dirty.There was no maid service at all!!!!! There wasn't an elevator! The beds were uncomfortable and dirty ,there was small hairs! The towels and bed linen had not been changed during 1 week! During the night there were the sounds coming from neighbouring rooms that kept us from resting! There is an incredible sound of the tram passing by near the hotel and there is the loud sound of the restaurant's music plus the sound people chatting from the street which waked me up several times at nights and made me having struggle in getting to sleep! The air-conditioner didin't work and it was very cold the TV was very ancient! The breakfasts were not very good-every day was the same things-eggs, cheese and jams! The lady in the kitchen was very friendly, but a little curious! The Reception Manager was pleasant but the other staff did not communicate well. Only the location was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two weeks and really enjoyed staying at the Atlantis. Staff at the desk were very helpful. The breakfasts were excellent with the staff keeping bowls stocked and catering to our needs by cooking eggs. The rooms were clean and we had good maid service. The price was reasonable. The internet is accessible in the lobby and free. The hotel is well located being only a short walk to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia museum and very importantly on a very short distance to the high speed modern tram stop. There are many restaurant and sweet and coffee shops only a short distance away. The hotel arranged for pick up at the airport and return to the airport. This was a big help.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ezha n
Reviews.Content: we had a great time in instanbul...atlantis hotel which is in the center of Sultanahmet made our trip tremendously convenient. almost every fabulous place was walking distance from the hotel.... the room was clean and definitely worth the price.. not to forget the excellent and helpful hotel staffs that made our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service for a basic hotel minutes away from everything”
Reviews.Author: Saeeeda
Reviews.Content: My friend and cousins stayed at the Atlantis in which we found great comfort and excellent service. I can not say enough about how pleasant and helpful the staff were. The management provide excellent customer service and are always ready to give good advice and support. Indeed, they helped us arrange the best tours of the city. We shared a family room which was smaller than expected (a double, a single and a camper bed). However, if we complained I reckon the manager would have changed rooms for us, but the room suited us. The room was small and plain and relatively basic nonetheless, it was comfortable and very affordable despite its location in the heart of a tourist capital. The only real downside was the dim lighting in the room and the lack of mirrors which is important for a group of girls who want to look glam as they hit the streets of Sultanahmet. We found it chilly at night and the air-con was not working however, this was promptly rectified by the management. Room service is basic, towels were changed daily and beds were made, but bedding was not changed. Please note that although there are no lifts (which was not an issue for our group) the staff will always assist you so donâ€™t be deterred. The breakfast was lovely and always fresh (cereal, bread, jam, butter, cheese, olives, meat, fruits, cake, milk, tea, coffee). You have to try the apple tea and the cake and bread (actually eat everything and drink the freshly made pomegranate juice. The lady in the kitchen makes you really feel at home she is genuinely sweet, incredibly warm and a real pleasure to see in the morning. The location has to be one of the best in Istanbul which is why we opted for it. It is centrally located in Sultanahment so you are in walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Cistern, Topaki Palace and Grand Bazaar. Additionally, you are 2 minutes away from the Tram and at a cost of 2 TL you can be at the Spice Bazaar in 10 minutes. We could see several restaurants from our room (be prepared to be hounded by the many waiters of these bars when you step out, and if you are a group of females be prepared for the endless attempts to woe you as they seek your custom, albeit in jest and we never felt intimidated once). The city was a blast and I would recommend staying at the Atlantis to anyone if you are on budget and need to be near to the main sights. We would love to come back to Atlantis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Rejected
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. I can not say enough about how helpful the staff was. The breakfast was outstanding, probably the best omelette I have ever eaten. The rooms were small and plain but comfortable and very affordable. The location has to be the best in Istanbul. We could see probably 10 restuarants from ourt room, but the best sandwich came from the little conv store across the street. The city was a blast and I would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Also close to ferry terminal and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: mark_SydNSW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights. The room was basic and tired but I didnâ€™t spend much time in it and for the price it was good value. It did have airconditioning which I appreciated. The location is excellent - as well as being close to the historic sites in the old city and the Bazaars it is easy to get to the ferry piers. (The ferries are good for a quick look at the harbour and also to get to the Asian side of Istanbul eg Kadikoy ). I walked to and from the pier but the tram line near the hotel also goes there and a tram stop is 2 minutes away. There are dozens of restaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel but they are aimed at tourists. Another option is Kadirga Limani Meydani, a town square about a 10 minute walk away with restaurants where locals eat as well as tourists. I found it when I went on the Lonely Planet Byzantium walk (if interested you could use the Lonely Planet directions to find it, or Googlemaps). I recommend that you AVOID the restaurant on the corner opposite the hotel (KARADENIZ Pide & Kebap Salonu) unless youâ€™re in the mood for an argument. I ordered from a picture on the menu and what I got didnâ€™t look anything like the picture and when the bill came it cost three times as much. Atlantisâ€™s other good points: (a) breakfast is included and is better than average - try the apple tea; (b) I got a free transfer from the airport because I stayed a minimum number of nights; (c) free internet PC in lobby for guests; (d) discount for paying in cash (euros). The ATMs at the airport dispense euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Olga S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, but comfortable, clean, with exellent location and good breakfast. The staff is very frendly and helpful. There is no elevator, but for me it is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ber F
Reviews.Content: Atlantis is located in Sultanahmet. Just a five minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Yerebatan.The hotelroom with airco we had was small but clean and (to be honest) we didn't come to Istanbul to spent much time at the hotelroom.On the roof terrace we enjoyed breakfast and a very friendly little woman offered us omelets every morning. Leaving the hotel you are immediately in a street with terraces, The tram station is also only two minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of sultanahmet...perfect for those who wants to be well located in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: atilamanager
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, surrounded by good restaurants and bazaars, confortable rooms and helpful staff 24 hours a day. Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: RT1234
Reviews.Content: Made a last minute booking via BA website (flight + stay) and landed at hotel (6 nights). Hotel had no confirmation of booking, manager Mr Mutlu was quite helpful and checked details. BA's supplier (JMC) had the booking at the website, but did not send it through the hotel. Family room was not available for that day and a smaller room was provided. Room was basic, but very good AC. The next day moved to a bigger family room. Room was good, but the AC was quite slow and took a very long time to cool the room (summer in Istanbul is quite hot). No fridge / mini bar in the room. Breakfast was decent (corn flakes, bread, jam, butter, cheese, olives, meat, fruits, cake, milk, tea, coffee) Location is bang in Sultanahmet. Get off at Sultanahmet tram stop, walk for 1 minute, see a McDonald, cross and get into the lane opposite and you can see the sign board for the hotel Mr Mutlu and Mr Hussen the two managers provide excellent customer service, always willing to help. Allowed us the use of microwave and fridge to store juice, etc. Would recommend this place if you are on budget and need to be near to the main sights RT

Reviews.Title: “small friendly hotel in nice area.”
Reviews.Author: Stig U
Reviews.Content: The staff is very pleasant and helpful, always ready to give good advice and support. Nice breakfast buffÃ© served on the roof top where the lady in the kitchen makes you really feel at home. Free acess to computer and Internet in the lobby adds to the value of this nice hotel. Although itÂ´s right in the middle of everything in this multimillionÂ´s city , with the crowded streets around the corner itÂ´s surprisingly calm and quiet at night. We would love to come back to Atlantis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value and location in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: queenjojo02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights after checking out of a hostel early and wish I'd found this place first! It was about 50AUD per night and had airconditioning (which is completely required in Istanbul in summer - seriously). I had a room on the second floor (205) overlooking the restaurants/cafes below, which was a room that could sleep 4 (I had booked a single room but they were out). The room is very basic. It had a double bed and 2 single beds. The bed/pillows were comfortable. The curtains and bedcover looked old and like they should be replaced. Bathroom was tiny but had a shower, sink, hair dryer and toilet. Airconditioner was great and you need to use it to drown out the voices from the restaurants below. The noise isn't too bad, but without the aircon it really does travel into the room. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was great - it's a buffet and delicious! Loved the breadrolls and cream cheese and yoghurt. No fridge/mini bar in room. Free wifi internet, but the quality of the connection wasn't great - e.g. I couldn't connect from the double bed easily, but could from the single bed nearest the door. So while these comments aren't overly too positive, for the price in Sultanahmet which is a tourist mecca I think the hotel is great value. You have a quiet room with aircon, wifi and your own bathroom. In Istanbul you're only in your room to sleep! Oh and the location is PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Turkeyloverpaolo
Reviews.Content: Atlantis is located in Sultanahmet, very near to Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Haghia Sofya etc. The hotel is n a small and quiet road. The staff is very kind and manager, mr Nasir, is very helpfull and kind, as well as professional. The terrace and breakfast are very good Against: The price has grown so much but this a problem for the whole Istanbul today.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MickinOz
Reviews.Content: This accommodation was perfect for my purposes. The central location in the Old City was most convenient â€“ close to many sites and services. The Sultanahmet tram stop was some two minutes walk and this made transit to the airport accessible and inexpensive. Rooms were simple but adequate and clean. The staff were most helpful and the provision of a good internet connection appreciated. A great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: rohit_agg
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of Atlantis Hotel...just a few steps away from the Sultanahmet tramstop, Blue mosque, Hagya sofya, etc.; lots of eating joints and a park across the tram station. The breakfast is a decent spread of fruits, bread, meats, etc. It is on the terrace which does not have great views but the lady there made eggs as per your choice! Our double room was not bad but the other quad room was very small with hardly any room to move about. There is no lift so be ready to carry your luggage (the reception person helped us though); also breakfast is on fourth floor. There are lots of bars around so if you do not want to be disturbed by the music, take a room on upper floors or on the side not facing the street. Be prepared to be hounded by the many waiters of these bars when you step out! There is a left luggage area and showers in the basement if you need to check out late. The staff is very helpful and courteous; they let us use their fridge as we needed to store some food. Hotel has free wifi and a computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great breakfast and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Jaackie
Reviews.Content: The best part of my stay was the breakfast which was generous with fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs to order and good coffee. The air conditioner worked well and helped block the street noise from restaurants in the area, which can get noisy as they stay open until 12:00 or later. The manager was very welcoming and offered us breakfast as we arrived early. We were given a swift ride to the airport, having stayed 4 nights. This is a good solid basic hotel, no frills, but it is well situated and economical. The rooms are worn & tired and it would be wise for the owner to invest a little bit back into the guest rooms, drapes, paint, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The excellent location makes up for the crappy hotel”
Reviews.Author: eveiveneg
Reviews.Content: I was afraid and hesitant upon first stepping into the lobby. It was a tiny, nondescript building nestled in the corner, among colorful restaurants and cafes in the side streets of Divan Yolu. (Divan Yolu is definitely a great location to be at. Easily walkable from here are the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, and a long line of restaurants and souvenir shops along the quaint, European-like street.) From Atlantis, it is literally a 30 second walk to Divan Yolu, which makes its location excellent, and its rate at about a third or half of the prices of the hotels you'd find on Divan Yolu itself. Just note though that Atlantis is kind of like in the parallel "back alley" of Divan Yolu, so don't expect fancy reception areas. And also, the taxis had no idea where it was and we had to go around for quite a bit to find it. this was because taxis weren't allowed on Divan Yolu, and a lot of one way streets. The taxi had to use a back street, then we were just dropped off at a corner and had to lug our suitcases down 200 meters or so of cobblestones (note: cobblestones are much more idyllic in books than in actuality--they kill your feet and make rolling your suitcase murder) before we got to the hotel. The rooms are odd-sized (some are really big, others really cramped, but at least not too tiny), with cheap wood floors, an area rug, decent bed, semi-dusty walls and a tiny tv, and a tiny bathroom with an all-in shower. What you would expect a budget place to have. But all in all, it was safe, the service of the front desk and housekeeping was excellent (very helpful and accommodating and answered all of our stupid touristy questions and helped us change money) and the good news is that they're renovating soon! So if you can ignore the slight discomfort of a hard-to-find address and wheeling your luggage down some pebbles, then the location really makes up for what it lacks in terms of shmanciness. Since you're going to be out for most of the day anyway, location trumps accommodation in this case. It was so easy walking everywhere! and a train station was right where the hotel's area was. So convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, pleasant staff, generous breakfast on rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: Galantuomo
Reviews.Content: Anyone visiting Istanbul to visit the primary historic sites - Aya Sofia, Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque, Topkapi Museum, Grand Bazaar could not have a better hotel location at a very affordable price. Staff were very helpful and friendly, and the extensive breakfast buffet on the rooftop terrace (4th floor, no elevator) offers an ideal way to begin each day. The area, although just steps away from the Sultanahmet Tram stop, is very quiet, with several pedestrian streets lined with very good restaurants, including the one on the corner in front of the hotel, and the Rumeli Restaurant on a nearby street.

Reviews.Title: “nice would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kc_austin78750
Reviews.Content: I loved yur hotel, place great, but no lift, and stairs quite narrow with no rail but everything else just great. kc, austin, tx.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel location is ideal and the staff is very attentive”
Reviews.Author: SAtrigal
Reviews.Content: Best location for sight seeing and shopping and eating. Superb staff who is very attentive. Turkish Breakfast added to our experience. Safe for morning runs too.

Reviews.Title: “'Price - Quality' ratio is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: l0tje
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the second time in Atlantis Hotel and was again surprised about how kind and helpful the staff is, the service they offer for such a relative low price and how hard the management and receptionists try to accomodate additional requests. It is very well located, but at the same time a quiet place to sleep. A highly recommended hotel in the hard of Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location, shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: lepinkypants
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic location, in close walking distance to all the tourist attractions and tram services. The room we had was a double room, the bed was a little hard for us but was comfortable and well aired. The only slight criticism we have is that the walls are quite thin, and some guests came back very late on the first night (I'm not sure if they were having a party in the canteen or in their room, but it was very loud!) so it was difficult to get asleep. However, on the subsequent nights we had no such issues and we got to sleep nicely. The hotel might do well to encourage guests to shush after 9pm or operate a lights out policy, and encourage those coming back in from town to keep their voices down. The breakfast was a buffet of olives, cheese, bread, cereal, some guests requested omelette, juices, jams, chocolate spreads, cake etc. All looked nice and fresh and well presented. The kitchen staff always were polite and friendly. Additionally, those working on reception always seemed very nice! Only one word of warning, as you are in the centre of town there are many bars and restaurants trying to get your custom and approaching you near the entrance to the hotel. It makes it a bit of a difficult experience to ignore people asking you to join their restaurant everytime you want to go to the hotel. However, I am sure this happens to all of the hotels in the area as it is a very touristy place and in a central location. Another quick thing to add here is that if you have never been to Istanbul, you may not know there is a massive stray dog problem and those strays are not treated very well. It's something all the hotels, restaurants, the government and local authorities should be dealing with. One night in this hotel I could hear a dog howling in pain in the street outside the hotel. It was not a very pleasant experience and I hope people keep this in mind when coming to Istanbul. It's not something mentioned in many of the tourist guides or reviews for the hotels I read before deciding to come here. The bedroom itself was clean and tidy, however, the bathroom could probably do with a little updating. If you are expecting the 3-5 star quality you get in a UK hotel then you might be disappointed. However, the room was more than adequate for our needs and the location of the hotel and the friendliness of staff trumped all of the minors nick picking of the hotel itself. If you want a hotel in the centre of the tourist area of istanbul, that is away from the main road, is nice and quiet, is in walking distance of nearly all major tourist attractions, you really cannot go wrong. I read many other Trip Advisor reviews before deciding on this hotel, and I have to say I was not disappointed and was very happy with the room and service we received. Overall we had a really nice stay in this hotel. We hope to come back to Istanbul again and would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Best conditions”
Reviews.Author: SalahAl-Musawi
Reviews.Content: In the middle of the old city â€žSultanahmedâ€œ, where every tourist attraction is in your nearness even the famous ones, you have the best possibility for sight seeing, shopping and even dining. With the central location of the hotel you have almost everything around you, even the tram station is only a 1 minute walk from the hotel. Although the room was a little bit small for 4 persons (1x Queen size bed and 2x single beds), but it was very clean and this is what actually maters. One of the plus points in the hotel is the breakfast buffet and not to forget the very friendly and polite staff starting from the reception till terrace. I personally would book there again :-)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent welcome in the middle of the historic center of Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: nantaise83
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nignts in this hotel wIth 3 teenagers : we found the staff helpful, ready to give informations. The room was very clean and spacefull, the breakfast inside a room on the roof was a pleasant moment . The ideal location, in front of the blue Mosquee is very appreciated : we'll keep a good memory of our stay

Reviews.Title: “Discrete and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Ana110851
Reviews.Content: Atlantis hotel is a discrete and unpretentious place with small rooms but it is the adequate place for a tourist avid to explore this remarkable and interesting city and stay most of the time out of the hotel. It is located near the most visited sightseeing monuments. It also offers a tasty and abundant breakfast buffet and a very grateful attention of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great holiday”
Reviews.Author: hayyaan
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights in Istanbul at the Atlantis hotel,would highly recommend to everybody.The staff especially Husnu and Mutlu were warm and welcoming

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: pqeess
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not a very fancy but an extremly fancy one. if you are seeking for a place which is close to the downtown but not so expensive, this hotel is perfect for you.the Haya Sofia and the Blue Mosgue is 2 mins walking distance, the Grand Bazar is 5mins. the staff is very helpful, the breakfast is decent, the price is reasonable. i really had a great time here, if i will have the opportunity to get back i plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worth the value”
Reviews.Author: frankyvr
Reviews.Content: the location is truly plus, you can reach all the interesting sites by walking distance. Helpful staff, they do give useful information and service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: issam_louhichi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Blue Mosque and to Ayasofia. You are really in the heart of the historical place "Sultanahmet". Also there are many restaurants and bars around. My room was big and very clean. The breakfast is amazing. The lady who is taking care of the breakfast is very kind and nice. The desk manager is very helpful. Don't be shy to ask him he knows a lot about Istanbul. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: afrozk
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly. Mutlu received us with a smile, and helped us with the bags. Gave us a lot of relevent information about places of interest. Just a hop skip and jump from the world famous Blue Mosque , Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar and the Topkapi Palace Museum. A must see for all visitors to Istanbul. The manager Mr Husnu is a warm and welcoming person, the place is clean and the breakfast is awesome and served by a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “We will return once again...”
Reviews.Author: katarina5358
Reviews.Content: Lokation of hotel Atlantis the excellent. The personnel affable, professional, friendly, is ready to answer all questions. Manager of front desk had quickly helped us to solve a small problem with the taxi driver who has brought us to hotel. Rooms small, but clean and cosy (we often lived in a room 201 and 202). After renovation rooms became better. A breakfast is good, meal is fresh and tasty - cheese, feta, sausage, eggs, olives, various bread, a fruitcake, tea, coffee, vegetables, fruit - everything that is necessary. The lady in a breakfastsroom is pleasant and friendly. Our last visit was from 07/01/2011 till 09/01/2011. We hope that we will return to Istanbul and in hotel Atlantis once again. I recommend this hotel to all who appreciates home atmosphere, attention, hospitality, cosiness.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Bibimaryam
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel started already back in Tashkent when I kept the correspondence with the hotel staff and it left so much positive impression on me, that I just went for it. I wasn't wrong, though my plane was delayed, they still met me at the airport, the driver made me smile and played some nice Turkish music on the way to keep my mood up. The staff at the hotel upon arrival didn't bother me about payment at all - they said I can whenever I will feelcomfortable as it's late now. That was such a nice welcome. They were always ready to assist. Besides, it's close to all sightseeing places one wishes to see. It's clean and cosy. It's safe as well considering I was solo female traveler. Breakfasts were sooooo nice, I really felt like home there. No matter whether you're travelling alone or in a company, I'd highly recommend to choose this very hotel as it's a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timtraveluz
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a very nice place to stay. Atlantis hotel is clean, the location is fantastic, it is located within a walking distance of the major historical sites., the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms are a bit small but very cosy.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DubrovnikCroatia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Istanbul and we spent 6 nights in Hotel Atlantis which is located just in the center of Sultanahmet, Istanbul. This hotel is very simple, excellent located, very clean and cheap with excellent stuff. It is very close (3-5 minutes walking) to all main atractions like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Basilica cistern, Grand Bazar..... On the arrival they arrange airport transfer for free because we booked room for 6 nights directly with them. It was nice bonus. Breakfast was served on the top of the hotel and it was great. There are a lot of restaurants all around where you can sit and enjoy excellent food and excellent Istanbul atmosphere. There is also tram station 2 minutes walking distance from hotel . You have to know this is not 5 star hotel but I think you can't find better hotel and better location for money you pay. This is my the third time in Istanbul and first time in this hotel. I will be back to this hotel again and we enjoyed Istanbul because Atlantis Hotel is excellent located in a very safe area. Thanks for everything and see you again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Made very welcome - hotel well situated”
Reviews.Author: heshvan
Reviews.Content: The Atlantis Hotel was one of three hotels that my cousin (from New Zealand) and myself (from England) resided during our time in Istanbul. Firstly the location is excellent being literally a minutes walk maximum to the tram route of Istanbul and close to many of the must see sites of the city. Very important for site seeing and also if you have heavy luggage and need to use the local and national transport, as we did to visit other parts of Turkey - this saved a lot of money by not using taxis. Don't be afraid of using the tram system - it is efficient and very cheap - same price for any destination. The Front Office Manager - Mr Husnu Nasir was a gentleman in every sense and a credit to the establishment. His calm, polite manner and willingness to assist and offer advice was much appreciated. The room was a little tired but clean and airy. Air conditioning included. A fridge in the room would have been a bonus though and the TV more conveniently sited for viewing. The breakfast was very good with a good selection and buffet style - so no moaning from me about going hungry. So - to sum this review up ... bear in mind this is not a large 5* hotel but it is value for money (in my opinion) when you consider its situation in the capital of Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “a very useful well run small place”
Reviews.Author: BathBill
Reviews.Content: I though the Atlantis Hotel was very situated with helpful staff and clean and comfortable It is unsuitable for anyone with mobility problems or needing an elevator

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great location for seeing all the sights in Sultanahmet, excellent breakfast, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Biddle007
Reviews.Content: We've been to this hotel before and find it so handy to see Old Istanbul. It's comfortable and the staff are friendly, English speaking and accommodating. The breakfast is very good and the cook is willing to 'do your egg' any way you desire.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Anzactravellers
Reviews.Content: One of the friendlist hotels we have stayed in - the service was great and the staff were very helpful thoroughly enjoyed our 5 day stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and staff. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Naheed30
Reviews.Content: I travelled with an infant and the staff were so helpful. I was able to use the fridge and kitchen facilities to make fresh milk for my infant. Breakfast was excellent with a delicious omelette every day! Staff were really friendly and we were given any assistance that was required. Great location, in the hub of it all, a bit noisy at night but if my infant can fall asleep and stay asleep then no real issues. Enjoyable stay made easy by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - small, friendly and good location.”
Reviews.Author: KThomas_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just what we needed for a short stay in Istanbul. Very central - a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque and other visitor attractions and very close to the tramway, which made getting about the city very easy. Staff at hotel were helpful and friendly and gave information about things to see and do in Istanbul. Lovely breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: nielsmantel
Reviews.Content: Very good value, excellent breakfast, good rooms and helpful staff. Can sometimes be noisy due to very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Central tourist location with great breakfast, but late-night noise”
Reviews.Author: reedrunner
Reviews.Content: The Atlantis really is in the center of the old town, located just uphill from the street car line, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and just downhill from the Grand Bazaar and Ã‡emberlitas Hamami (turkish bath). However, you pay for this convenience. You have to 'run the gauntlet' of restaurant hawkers everytime you leave or return to the Atlantis. In addition, the restaurant noise continues until at least 1 am each night. Mornings are very quiet until at least 9am. The rooftop breakfast terrace was the highlight of this hotel. Breakfast includes a variety of Turkish and Western offerings including fresh-made omelettes and exceptionally good tomatoes and cheese. Rooms are OK. They were clean, but furnishings were worn and the outside paint was peeling from the window frames, (an issue because the frames swing inward.) WiFi signal did not reach our room, but worked in lobby and breakfast terrace. Tip - If you plan to take a taxi, print the street detail map for the driver. Our decades-of-experience driver had to stop for directions to figure out the last couple blocks. Apparently, 'Atlantis Hotel' is a newer name. In hindsight we should have taken public transit from the airport since the hotel is so close to the street car line.

Reviews.Title: “Please, stay here”
Reviews.Author: EduardoOrtiz
Reviews.Content: Value for money; excellent location... all you need to see and to do in Istanbul is around this excellent hotel: Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, HagiaSophia, a nice Turkish Bath, the Bosphorus, etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Desirable location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nvulpe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Atlantis is located right in the middle of some of Istanbul's most interesting sites--a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia; two stones' throw from Topkapi. It is in a back street and 50 metres from the tramway (Sultan Ahmet/Blue Mosque). The hotel is modest, but good value for the money. Staff are polite and very helpful. Breakfast is good. The room was spares, but in Istanbul who wants to stay in a room. It had looked out to the many tourist restaurants, which meant that one night I found it difficult to sleep until quite late--the night clerk was kind enough to call to ask them to turn the music down. I'll probably go back on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we found the Atlantis!”
Reviews.Author: MaxKHat
Reviews.Content: We travel to Istanbul frequently and have stayed in numerous budget hotels. The Atlantis was a great find. Pros: Friendly service lacking absolutely nothing, larger than typical room, air conditioning that worked, free wireless, a very satisfying Turkish breakfast with cooked omelet if desired (the sweet couple who serve breakfast do deserve tips), daily cleaning service, and a superb location just a skip from Sultanahmet tram stop. As for the price, you just can't beat it for what you get (remember, I am talking about budget category). Con: I never travel without them, but here you will be glad to have not forgotten your ear plugs. The outdoor restaurants below can be quite noisy if you want to go to bed early. We will definitely plan to make Hotel Atlantis our regular place to stay when we want to be in Sultanahmet! We were really happy with our 6 night stay at the Atlantis.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable Staff and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: gmjenny
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for three evenings in August. The hotel is very, centrally located in Sultanahmet. This neighborhood is great for people who want to be in the center of the nightlife and conveniently located by Istanbul's most popular monuments, such as the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, and Blue Mosque. The staff was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions. The hotel was clean, and the breakfast was excellent. The hotel management also allowed us to store our larger pieces of luggage while we left the city on a three-day trip to the coast. The only downside to our stay was that some of the restaurants and nightlife in the area can be rather loud. So, simply bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. All in all though, I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting smiling faces at the breakfast after a good sleep in the nice , cool bed!”
Reviews.Author: paivi_10
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Hotel Atlas, which is the best place to explore amazing Istanbul. It's easy and safe to walk around to the top places (late evening, too) - or to jump in to the tram and get quickly to the other side of the bridge. Still the hotel is quiet and cool in the nights - the beds are great. I had very good sleeps! The tasty breakfast was served on the roof top with hospitality and lovely smiling faces. For me it was very important to have free access to the internet and to remove the photos from my camera to my memory stick. Everybody was so friendly during my stay! Surely I will stay in Hotel Atlas during my next visit to Istanbul - I hope very soon...

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in central location with misleading reviews...”
Reviews.Author: travellingcherry
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel must have been written by people who have not stayed anywhere else in Istanbul. While the location is central, it is the only hotel in the area for a reason - the streets below are filled with restaurants which play loud music until the early hours of the morning and the area is not easily accessible by car which means a sweaty slog through the cobbled back streets with your suitcases. Certainly you get what you pay for: the basic rooms have clean sheets, air conditioning and a small television but no fridge and my toilet was clean but smelly. The staff were a little abrasive and the service sullen. Finally, breakfast was basic but nothing compared to others in Istanbul which feature salads, meats, pancakes, waffles and fruits. This hotel is a budget hotel but I would recommend adding an extra Â£5 - Â£10 a night to your budget for a totally different class of hotel. The extensive public transport service in Istanbul renders such a centralised location unnecessary - head out a little bit for more modern rooms, better staff and better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I like Mr. Husnu's hair :)”
Reviews.Author: farhaana
Reviews.Content: I'm not bias because I like his hair. Hahaha :) The service is actually very good. Even before the trip. We even booked a transfer service at a reasonable price. The best thing about Alantis Hotel is, the breakfast. Very friendly staffs... The ommelete is nice. The reception people are helpful too!!~ I must say, I'm very particular about toilets, this one is clean... Small, but clean. It's nowhere near Atlantis Dubai (Hahaha :p), but it's sure worth the amount you paid for (I think...)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, central location and pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cmtml
Reviews.Content: Atlantis hotel is perfect for those looking for a clean, quiet, simply place to sleep whilst enjoying Istanbul. It is so centrally located, just off the main street from the Blue Mosque and tram line. Breakfast is served on the roof-top terrace which is lovely. The terrace is also available for starting off those evenings where you might want to escape the busy restaurants and bars and enjoy perhaps that nice bottle of whatever you bought in duty free (highly recommended - as booze in Turkey is expensive). Staff are verty friendly and the free internet access in the lobby is great for search for travel trips around the city. Recommend the fantastic bar/restaurant just on the corner around from the hotel and the hostel opposite which has a roof top terrace also with a magnificent view of blue mosque. We spent 10 days in istanbul and tried several hotels on trip advisor - as we wanted to experience different parts of istanbul - but we thought this location was our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: pitus25
Reviews.Content: This property is located in the centre of the historical district of Sultanahmet, close to all attractions. My room was clean and very comfortable. Good airconditioning and no noise at night. Don't think you can do any better for the price. It has a nice, cosy and relaxed atmosphere too. Breakfast was jenerous and served on a tarrace. Highly recommended for singles. Free wired and wireless internet was a great bonus. Staff was always ready to help and very friendly.Thank you for the good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to discover this beautiful Town”
Reviews.Author: mfez
Reviews.Content: A very nice hÃ´tel with very helpful and friendly peoples. Our journey was simply fantastic Special thanks and regards to the women in charge of the breakfast. Isabelle and Marc

Reviews.Title: “Good cost benefit relationship.”
Reviews.Author: zamorano76
Reviews.Content: It is a sober hotel, very well located. I coincide with previous comment regarding the fact that not many people, not even taxi drivers, know where the hotel is located. Service is very good. Breakfast at the terrace is very generous. If I go back to Istanbul, I would go to Atlantis again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,friendly manager and staff,good room,fabulous breakfast what else do you need”
Reviews.Author: Aucklandblondie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for sightseeing to Blue Mosque,Hagia Sophia,Bazaars etc.Tram(trolley bus) at end of street for other side Taksim Sq .The manager was extremely helpfull and freindly. We arrived very early and had travelled a long distance and was offered breakfast .In a short time (well before check in ) our room was ready.Clean and tidy .Bathroom small and shower head attachment loose but good hot water.No noise problem although restaurants below.Breakfast was great,plenty of choice

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SujathaChennai_India
Reviews.Content: Atlantis is ideally located within walking distance of major historical sites. The service is courteous and the breakfast wholesome.On the whole it is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel in the very old city centre (Istanbul)”
Reviews.Author: Odissej
Reviews.Content: This is no luxury hotel. My family (i.e. he, she and the son of 9 years old) came here for 5 days. We never stayed in the hotel but for night sleep and for breakfast in the morning. It has very convenient location: just next to the city tram station, by which you can travel to numerous places in the town and out of it. Also you can walk very easily to all directions in the old city of Istanbul, Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque standing next to it. For our purposes it suited us almost perfectly: nice location, clean, rather economical (we booked the room a month ahead, by the time we were travelling (beginning of May) the price went 2 or more times up), friendly staff, clean. Rooms are small, and as we lived on the second floor - below on the street we could hear loud taks of nearby numerous restarants visitors. But then after all day long walkings through the city we just have to take off the clothes, have shower and sleep dead ) Two minor drawbacks: 1) the hotel cafe is at the roof, as is tradition here I guess, and this is also very convenient - but there were no great views to the sea from there, only neighbouring roofs 2) breakfast menu was no huge range of choices. Very limited. We asked every day to cook us scrambled eggs, which we received. But then, as a hotel for night stay and all the rest of the time - travelling around - this is a good one! It is an older one, I would suppose, but if you compare it with others, and if in price it will be competitve - take it. Also, the front office manage was very friendly and helped us every time we had questions. Also, there was free internet access in there, but the PC was a little out of order. On the other hand, there is an internet cafe just next door there, very convenient. We used it to drop all our pictures from the camera to the flash memory - several times... we really spent most of the time walking and photo hunting than enjoying hotel life. In the end, I would say this place is a good one to stay in Instabul for the first time. If we come there for the second one, I'd choose a place closer to Eminoenue - more convenient to travel to farther parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Small charming hotel in the middle of all the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: sineorita00
Reviews.Content: pros: 1. The manager at this hotel was very nice and helpful. 2. The hotel is central to many attractions including Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Hamam (Turkish Bath), etc. 3. Yummy breakfast included 4. Free internet in lobby cons: 1. My room was tiny 2. It's often loud around the hotel, even late at night tip: My flight was delayed and the hotel transportation showed up to the airport anyway. Thus, I had to take a taxi home on my expense when I finally did arrive. So, make sure if you have any flight changes you contact the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good service”
Reviews.Author: MarronSollentuna
Reviews.Content: We were four teachers and 4 students from Sweden staying at the hotel for one night and we were very satisfied with the location and the service at the hotel. We arrived at 5.30 p.m and left the hotel the next morning at 6.30 and during this short stay we managed to visit the Grand Bazar, The Blue Mosque, stroll around in Sultanahmet and had a very nice dinner at a restaurant just a few steps from the hotel. We were served an early breakfast at the terrass of the hotel and used the shuttle service to go to the airport. We were very pleased with the hotel and impressed by the cleaness and standard. The only inconvenience was that there is no elevator in the hotell. The sound from the restaurants in the street was quite loud till midnight, but we were not very disturbed. It was a perfect location for a short time visit of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Elsju
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel and had the best time ever. Location is excellent so close to all the major sights. The breakfast is great and we loved the lady who served it! The rest of the staff is friendly and very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and frienly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azra55
Reviews.Content: Old but comfortable hotel. I was more than one time in this hotel because I can feel family atmosphere. There is home environment and you can meet only friendly staff from reception desk (where is man with the most beautiful eyes) to restaurant (with very kind lady).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and perfect service”
Reviews.Author: marcosfg
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and perfect service. Next to a tramway station and very near sultanhamet place.

Reviews.Title: “Atlantis Hotel - a hidden gem in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Sally22_2_uk
Reviews.Content: This is a small friendly hotel with a superb location in the heart of Sultanahmet. Probably difficult to find if you don't know where you are going, thus I would advise to use their shuttle service upon arrival. Amazingly quiet at night considering its central location! Would use this hotel again if I need to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and will return”
Reviews.Author: stasiaAustralia
Reviews.Content: I happily extended my stay at the Atlantis Hotel from 5 to 7 nights and I will book again when I return to Istanbul in a few months. The location is excellent for everything you will want in Sultanameht. The Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque are less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The Hippodrome is across the road and so on. The hotel is small, very well run and very clean. The rooms are comfortable and nicely appointed for the price range. The hotel is excellent value for money. The breakfast is very good. All the staff were helpful. Perhaps most importantly, the management are very helpful. As a single traveller speaking only English, their assistance with travel arrangements and finding unusual locations was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “i cant decide if i liked it”
Reviews.Author: vangel1981
Reviews.Content: great location very friendly staff in the reception and the lovely woman in the breakfast room.but no comments about the room

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy Istanbul with confortable accomodation and staff's flexibility”
Reviews.Author: wakako1026
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on April 2010 for 5 days total. That was my third time in Istanbul and I stayed different places before but I am telling you that this was the most confortable place I have ever stayed in Istanbul. Though located Sutanahmet, you will enjoy relaxing and warm service. Staff are very professional and they spoke great English so you won't have any trouble. You can enjoy lovely break fast at balcony. Should be really nice on summer. My stay was really busy this time. I stayed Istanbul ,Brusa and other place. But thans to their flexibility, I could have safe and great journey. I might come back Istanbul near future but I am sure that I will stay this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacation_10
Reviews.Content: An excellent location to stay for light travellers. Tourist attractions located in old town are close by. Sultanahmet tram station is less than 5 minutes walk away. Nice to have breakfast served at patio located at the top of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chydon
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive comments about this hotel. The location was perfect and within easy walking distance of the Sultanhamet sites and the tram. It was clean,the staff were very helpful and the availability of the Internet for checking in for our return flight was an asset. The photo's on the website reflect accurately the rooms which could do with a bit of updating with regards the furniture. The bed however was very comfortable. We did not find it a particularly noisy area but it was out of season, although the restaurants nearby were usually quite full. It may be different depending on the room you have. The downside is the stairs. They are quite steep so may be a challenge if you have a medical problem. Otherwise they keep you fit ! There would be no point in choosing a room on a lower floor - breakfast is served on the terrace at the top. We personally found all the restaurants in the street,to the right of the hotel as you come out, to be excellent. Very clean, and friendly staff. Prices vary slightly as do the menus but we did not think prices were excessive for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for adults”
Reviews.Author: KurdiMomm7
Reviews.Content: We checked in late but they were very kind about it and even helped with our luggage. The hotel is clean and nicely decorated, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. However I would not recommend this hotel to people who are traveling with small children as there is nothing for them to do and every sound carried alot (we were on the 3rd floor and heard everything above and below us) also this is not a hotel for disabled travelers because there is no elevator only a spiral staircase which was a little challenging even for me. The only other downfall to this hotel is that it is a bit difficult to find, as it's behind a resturant and there aren't any signs that you can see from the street, It is however only a minute walking from the Metro station and there are plenty of places to eat and shop just steps away from the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Atlantis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: planetsolutions
Reviews.Content: Your service to my family while we were in Istanbul had been impeccable at all times and extremely efficient, especially when we needed certain things done urgently. I found you and Atlantis Hotel to be a very reliable with a team of experts who believe in providing a good service to its clients and look forward to an ongoing relationship with you. I can not say enough how helpful it was to have Atlantis Hotel while we are stuck in Istanbul due to volcanic ashes, arranging a room in a very short time, arranging a taxi, calling and checking with airline and airport continuously , booking taxi, providing all what we needed. We are extremely pleased with the service we receive from Atlantis Hotel. They are always professional and get the job done. All I can say is whenever we ask for their services, they do a fantastic job and come highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: docman77
Reviews.Content: Really well situated, within spitting distance of the Hagia Sofia mosque in the sultanahmet district. The hotel is essentially an old mansion, converted into a simple, no frills hotel. Not that many amenities to offer, but to be fair the staff are really friendly (especially one of the receptionists by the name of Mutlu), and the view from the roof is incredible as well. The hotel manager by the name of Husnu Nasr is a little stand offish. I ran into him because I had to change my reservation, which I had emailed him about well in advance. He really wasn't too gracious about it, in fact was bordering on rude. But luckily for everyone, he isn't there too much, and everyone else is exceedingly helpful. I would probably stay there again if they can get rid of Mr Nasr :).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: UkPatel
Reviews.Content: really had a good time in Istanbul, Hotel was very central , staff were very friendly and courteous, especially Huraya who served scramptious ommelletes with a smiling face. Stairs were bit difficult for the middle aged, ask for first floor room if available

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure best of sultanahmet ..”
Reviews.Author: sevdalina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights.Everything was wonderfull.If we come back to istanbul absoultly we will stay in Atlantis hotel...

Reviews.Title: “ddd”
Reviews.Author: hephaestus7
Reviews.Content: Atlantis is a nice place for a short stay in Istanbul. it provides easy access to public transportation system and it is 2-3 minutes away from main tourist destinations of Istanbul. the manager and staff are very helpful and hospitable and the breakfast is good. the stone paved alleys leading to the hotel are very friendly and nice and accumulated with restaurants and bars. The only not-so-good thing about the location is that it is overwhelmed with tourists. for the people who don't like to be drawned among tourists from different nations it could be annoying.

Reviews.Title: “SImple but good hotel with respectful personnel, great location”
Reviews.Author: basil_jamil
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to Istanbul pretty spontaneously over the internet. My choice was guided above all by the positive reviews regarding the service - the fact that the location is fantastic was obvious anyway. But I can confirm how comfortable I was made to feel. The staff at the reception - manned 24 hours a day - spoke english at a reasonable or even good level - actually, much more than basic, and the staff were polite with no trace of being sycophantic. I was not disappointed at all. It was a good choice - and I would recommend the hotel to all who need a decent but not necessarily top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: BestTraveler05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice compared to the low prices - it is recommended to overnight a bit further than the trafficked street - and at the same time it is close to everything, metro, historical sites, shops and restuarants, very good security and cleaning standard - the view is not the best - but instead you get a lot of peace and rest from the quite overcrowded main street:)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tawnstar
Reviews.Content: great spot for all the tourist attractions. Right near the tram stop so very easy to get around. Rooms were small, basic but very clean. breakfast was also basic but lovely!!!!! Staff were very helpful. All in all.....would definately recommend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are correct: Cheap, Clean, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: BONJACOBS
Reviews.Content: Atlantis is exactly what its reviews and photos say. Cheap, Clean, Great Location. Solid service with especial praise for the woman who makes the omletes with a big smile. This was my second time to Constantinople and I brought 11 people which required 5 rooms. No one had any complaints. I think we got more for our money. The restaurant out the door on the corner on the right was the best one we ate at. We ate there three times.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: UsaAudrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nicely located (steps away) to the tram system,attractions, shopping, ATM + currency exchange facilitiy, and dining. The rooms were simple but clean and the staff was very helpful with any needs. The breakfast was fantastic - great omletes! All guest rooms within the walled part of Istanbul will hear the call to prayers,street noises, and rooster calls - so I do not think that this hotel was any quiter or noiser than the next B+B. I would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service with superb location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelKitten2
Reviews.Content: The service at the Atlantis Hotel was everything one would expect from a hotel- room cleaning every day, an incredible breakfast every morning, and friendly front desk personnel. The rooms are very comfortable and characteristic of Istanbul, and include accessible bathrooms. The hotel is tucked one street away from businesses and noise, and is located in an an exceptional part of the Sultanahmet, surrounded by shops, transportation, restaurants, and historical places. The only cons would probably be the thin walls, which transfer sound from room to room. If you're looking for a peaceful night, you'll have to luck out with your neighbors, as some people can be rowdy. Also, the stairs can be a pain to climb multiple times everyday, as they are spiral and covered with additional carpeting. Other than minor things, the hotel is superb, especially for those who get out and enjoy the city, only to really use their room at night. The breakfast each morning is very nutritional and sets one up for a day of sightseeing and walking. There is also internet access on a computer located in the lobby, password-inclusive for personal devices.

Reviews.Title: “get the best for what you spend. It really worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Bennie7777
Reviews.Content: Although Atlantis Hotel is a small 3 star hotel but I have to say that when I compare it with the 4 star hotel from my previous trip to Istanbul, I have to say that Atlantis Hotel is a lot better. When you arrive you will be welcomed by very polite and responsible staff. During my stay in Atlantis hotel I had no problem at all. in case of any inconvenience the professional staff do what ever in their power to make you feel you are in a 5 star hotel. The location of Atlantis hotel is brilliant. very close to the tramva and historic places and the bayazid bazaar. If you value your money and want to have good time Atlantis hotel is the best choice. Bahman H. UK

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mirabba
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for one week and we enjoyed our stay. The staff was very kind and helpful specially the front office manager HÃ¼snÃ¼, also the expeditionist Mutlu and the staff in the kitchen Huriye. If we go to Istanbul again we will definetly go to hotel Atlantis again. Robin, SWEDEN

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: swheely
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Atlantis for long weekend, for sightseeing and shopping! Fantastically positioned for both - 5 minutes to Aghia Sophia and Blue Mosque and the same to the Grand Bazaar. Incredibly friendly staff, basic but spotlessly clean room with plenty of space. Breakfast was great - nice views over the rooftops of Sultanahmet and great omelettes served by lovely, very smiley lady. Great restaurants in the vicinity too. Would not hesitate to come back and probably will when the weather is better - it was the only thing that spoilt it - - very low cloud meant you didn't get spectacular views!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: racingsailor69
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Atlantis. Staff were very helpful and spoke exellent English. The stairs to the roof top eating area might be tough for those with gamey knees, but the hike up there was worth the effort. The breakfast was perfect to get our touring day started and we had a bit of a view of the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rokpok
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to expend a lot of money, this is a good option. It is near a tram stop, the Blue Mosque and other attractions. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is ok. My only complaint is the lack of an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DASMoscow
Reviews.Content: Hotel isn't expensive, the room is small but homelike and very clean. Personal is very friendly and helpful. We felt us how at home, not how in hotel. It is located near major sights and (importantly for us) tram station for travel in Istanbul by ourselves. There are many cafe and shops near hotel. It was a pleasure to stay in Atlantis Hotel. We will recommend Atlantis Hotel for stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Atlantis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryReilly0101
Reviews.Content: Excellent value hotel, good location for night life. May be a bit noisy in high season. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was a bit dated but was very clean. The hotel provides a transfer service from Ataturk airport at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Think about your trip and not about your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_2000
Reviews.Content: To enjoy Istanbul you have to spend time mostly outside! And to have a good rest and breakfast Atlantis is a nice place. It's located in the very center of the ancient city, has friendly stuff and comfortable rooms. The prices are acceptable; you can also ask for some additionals, rent a car and so on. There is one-way transfer from (to) international airport included for more than 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay at an average price”
Reviews.Author: MadridInfame
Reviews.Content: In the middle of Sultanahmet, this quite, staff friendly, hotel is perfect if you want to enjoy Istanbul. Clean rooms and an extraordinary breakfast buffet are the stars of this hotel, that gives you exactly what you pay for: a nice place to stay at an average price. If only all these hookers who work at the bars sorrounding the hotel woldn't bother you constantly with offers...

Reviews.Title: “Good money for value, but value is low”
Reviews.Author: uassaganassa
Reviews.Content: Nothing to add to the title of my reiview. Ptice i fair, but room quality is quite low. Personell is very charming and helpfull. Location is very good, Good money for value, but value is low I think is the right title to review the holtel

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SANA6469
Reviews.Content: The staffs were reliable, efficient, informative and hospitable The breakfast was excellent and the kitchen staffs were awesome The location of the hotel is superb

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to select this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: FreedomAndJustice
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 25th and 29th Nov 09. Hotel location is perfect, you can reach anything easily. It's very near the Tram Station. There are many other hotels in this area, mostly they advertise that they are near "blue mosque", "Topkapi Palace". But Blue Mosuqe and palace is huge square !! So, if you travel to Sultanahmet by Tram, you have to walk walk walk maybe 1 Kilometre to reach the hotel. (But if you don't mind, it's fine because scenery in this place is nice !!!!) Staff are very helpful, nice, polite and always willing to give you information or reply any of your inquiries. And the most important thing for me is....blanket, mattress and tower are clean.. Even there is no "mini bar", but it's not a problem at all as there is small grocery shop near the hotel, just very near like 6 foot steps only. As for meal, don't worry, there are many resteraunts in this area ! Comment :Hotel Breakfast should, it's better if hotel can provide more choices for BF.

Reviews.Title: “Best area to be in, and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nonameSheffield
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a stonesthrow from Sultanahmet Square with all its magnificent attractions. There are many restaurants on the doorstep, catering for all tastes and budgets. The hotel itself does an excellent breakfast considering its small size. The bed was comfortable with lovely,soft pillows, which perhaps does not sound so important but I longed for such softness after experiencing some of the neck-breakers that I found in other hotels as I crossed Turkey. The hotel has free internet access which is a boon because there seems to be a dearth of internet cafes in Istanbul, in the old parts of the city at any rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CurlyGurl_9
Reviews.Content: Well-situated within a short walk of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi and the light rail station. Lots of restaurants nearby. The staff is helpful and warm, it has a charming rooftop dining area for breakfast, and is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Atlantis is a friendly helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: malcolm_of_warwick
Reviews.Content: Situated in a delightful alley thronged with lots of excellent little restaurants and just one minute from a very busy streer in the heart of old Istanbul. Several exciting attractions are just minutes walk away. The excellent and cheap tram and metro system connect most conveniently to Attaturk airport. No need to arrive by taxi; the tram stop (look for the name Sultanahmet) is just one minutes walk from this hotel. Staff always very helpful, anxious to assist, nothing was too much. Ensuite room though not modern was clean, comfortable and quite adequate for two. Hot water shower was superb; I had just completed the Marathon, finishing line a short walk away. On the day of the Marathon the staff even cooked me a very early simple breakfast, at no extra charge. Public internet facility in the lobby was fast, convenient and no extra charge. The dining room on the top floor is very pleasant, clean and offers a wide range for breakfast. Regrettably, access to the hotel, rooms and dining room would be difficult, almost impossible, for guests with severe mobility impairment. On the day we checked out the hotel looked after our luggage until our time arrived. The price was very competitive. Friends staying elsewhere paid considerably more for no more. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, provided you can walk up flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia024
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for four nights and was very pleased. The staff was always friendly and helpful, the location is superb for sightseeing. The rooms are basic but perfectly adequate and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was very good. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: asma_ua
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 2 year old child on the end of October 2009. The stay was mostly pleasant. The hotel is in a good location. near to all the major attractions. It is very clean. The staff's attitude is exceptional. They make you feel welcome and relaxed. They all fussed around my daughter and she really liked that (and it gave me an opportunity to quickly check my e-mails, etc). The hotel is not child friendly in a sense that the staircase is really dangerous for the less able. The room was clean but dated. I did not like the shower as there was no screen, only curtains, and water was all over the floor. There is quite a lot of noise coming from outside. You can hear people talking in the restaurants, music playing. Normally it's not that loud. But couple of nights there were some sort of parties somwehere in the are and I even woke up at 2 am from loud music, then could not sleep until 4 am until it finished. So yes bring ear plugs just in case. The breakfast was ok as well. I would definetely go there agin though as overall I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very friendly and helpful and idealy located.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find! The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful, and the reception desk is staffed 24 hours a day. The rooms are comfortable but not luxurious and individually air conditioned, though we did not need that in September. Breakfast is excellent - bread, cheese, cereal, fruit, fruit juice, tea, good coffee, and of course the excellent omlettes that are cooked to order by a charming woman who (like all the staff) takes a real pride in her work. The location could not be better. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace, the Great Cistern and the Grand Bazaar are all a short walk away - and each is in a different direction, so you are not retracing your steps. There's also a Turkish Bath close by. The excellent tram stops just 100 yards away. It runs down to the quays where the tour boats dock and close to the Spice Market and then over the Galata Bridge and links with the funicular railway up to Taksim square. The hotel has its own integral travel agency and they are very helpful, but they do not push it to you. The freely available computer in the hall is very useful. And when you are tired and hungry at the end of the day, the best restaurant in the area - the Konak - is just across the road, 20 yards away. The food is excellent and the staff are very friendly. We hope to return to Istanbul soon, and we know where we'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice - try this one!”
Reviews.Author: SomersetGraham
Reviews.Content: Ideal location on the Golden Horn for visiting the local "must see" sites. All the staff were most helpful and pleasant, and we enjoyed a nice breakfasts on the rooftop terrace. There is free 24 hour internet access for those who need it, on a computer in the lobby. The rooms were adequate, but obviously if you are in a 3 star hotel, don't expect perfection. You will have to pay treble the amount the Atlantis charge to get that. They arrange shuttle transport back to the airport if required. There is a potential parking problem if you are using a car, though you might strike lucky and get a spot at the rear of the hotel. Of the four hotels we used on our tour, this was the least expensive, and yet the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: umlungu
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel for our first night in Istanbul. There was nothing wrong with the room. The roof top breakfast was really great. After going to another cheaper hotel for the second night we were extremely disappointed. We came back to Atlantis but unfortunately there were no free rooms. The staff was really helpful helping us to find a room in another hotel. They made several calls and arranged a discount for us. The location of this hotel is also really great!

Reviews.Title: “You stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SaoPauloTravelagent
Reviews.Content: If location is important this is the place to stay. Room is ok. Staff is very nice but what really amazes is the location! Close to everything that matters. If you are taking a taxi to hotel from the airport, a great clue to the driver is to let you off right in front of Macdonalds at SultanAhmet. The street to the hotel is right across it (taxi drivers never find the place which is really not very easy to find). Going to Istanbul again, would stay at Atlantis for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no hassle and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mercury1nat
Reviews.Content: We took two days in Istanbul before a trip to Kazakhstan, so we wanted to see the main sites quickly and easily. The location of this hotel was perfect, seconds from the Blue Mosque and just off the busiest streets. We found the roof terrace breakfast nice and the staff friendly. The price wasn't bad for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OhioFlyers
Reviews.Content: This clean, friendly hotel is only 10 to 15 minutes walk from some of Istanbul's most famous points of interest. These include the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Camii), Haghia Sophia Museum, Topkapi Palace Museum, the Basilica Cistern, and the Grand Bazaar (Kapail Ã‡arÅŸi). It is also only one block from the tram line that runs up and down Divanyolu Caddesi which will get you quickly to the Spice Market (Egyptian Bazaar), the Galata Bridge, and the boat piers for Bosphorous Cruises. Our room showed a bit of age but was very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed A/C, a small clean bathroom with shower. We had a television but you only get Turkish television channels. There was a variety of different, delicious, "cold" items available in the breakfast buffet. And "hot" foods custom made at your request. The breakfast is served on the rooftop with indoor and outdoor seating. There were plenty of smiles and cordial service, especially from Huriye, our cook. There is a small, convenient market (AlkoÃ§ Market) in the same building that has a variety of well priced beverages, produce, and snacks available. There is a full service travel agancy next door that arranged a very enjoyable, cost-effective, all-day excursion to Gallipoli battlefield for us. We recommend them. There are very many restaurants around the hotel (so many that you can't possibly eat at all of them in a one-week stay). We recommend the economical Dolphin Restaurant, the very convenient Konak Restaurant, and the rather elegant Khorasani OcakbaÅŸi Kebabhouse, all within a block of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: Andysurf
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a fantastic location! It may be inexpensive, but it's clean, friendly & quiet. We arrived early (9.30 am!) intending to just drop off our bags, but were immediately shown to our room & invited to have breakfast (no extra charge). The room was the largest we had in 3 weeks of travelling & the staff were unfailingly helpful & polite - plus the lady cooking breakfast omelettes was the smiliest ever! All in all it was exactly what we wanted & in the perfect location. Can't think how anyone found it noisy. Our room was at the front & we were there during Ramadan when the streets were heaving, but we scarcely heard a sound. Free wi-fi & use of computer in lobby was a useful bonus. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: richardpusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with my 2 children. The rooms were more than adequate for us, the staff were unfailingly helpful, and the rooftop breakfasts were really great (and my children are picky). For the price and location this was a really fine choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: v_xara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlantis for three nights in august 2009. Overall it was a wonderful stay. The staff were very polite and attentive and they even managed to check us in early. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace is a very nice addition and it always had a large variety of things to choose from. I also really liked the free internet in the lobby (apparently, they also have free wi-fi but we never used it). I would say that this is a definite top-pick since it is literally a minute away from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque but, because it is on a side street, you don't have to deal with the nonstop noise coming from the bars, terraces and so on.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at Atlantis are very friendly and helpfull and the hotel is very well situated.”
Reviews.Author: johnnyjive
Reviews.Content: We stayed (2 adults and 2 children -10 & 14) for 2 nights and 1 night 4 days later.The staff are very helpful,the price is more than reasonable, breakfast was fantastic (ask for an omelet) and the rooms are comfortable (remembering this is not 5 star). Location is great, right next to lots of nice restaurants and the Blue Mosque only a few minutes away. Any Australians going to Gallipoli could ask Onur for travel advise but just make sure you get taken back to the right part of Istanbul on your return.Also make sure which airport you are arriving at.The European airport is about 20 mins from the hotel but the Asian airport is about to 2 hours away.Taxi drivers do seem to get lost (the area is pedestrians only) so direct them to a landmark or the nearest tram stop (Sultanahmet). I would definately stay at The Atlantis again and ALL the staff where very friendly and helpful. Thanks very much

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: lapseofreason
Reviews.Content: The Atlantis is clean and comfortable and situated within easy walking distance of Istanbul's major sites. The staff will go out of their way to be friendly and helpful and the breakfast is terrific! We will stay here again the next time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Istanbul Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarcHildreth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlantis hotel, Istanbul for 2 weekends this June and it was a pleasant experience. The hotel is a little hard to find for cab drivers, (the Atlantis is aptly named!!), since itâ€™s on a pedestrian street, however that was half the charm of the place. Itâ€™s nestled in the Sultanahmnet area bang in the heart of the old city. We were 10 minutes walking distance from the Blue Mosque and the Hagiya Sofiya and 3 minutes from the Sultanahmet tram stop. The hotel itself is small and the rooms are basic (but critically clean & hygienic!), however this was more than compensated by the wonderful location and extremely helpful staff. Itâ€™s surrounded by bustling cafÃ©â€™s and shopsâ€¦ we felt transported instantly to old world Istanbul!! I would recommend the Atlantis if youâ€™re focused on exploring the old city with all its sights and sounds and want to be in a safe, welcoming, clean, value-for-money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mysa1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at Atlantis Hotel. Hotel is situated on short walking distance from the Blue Mosque & Ahia Sofia (10 minutes). Tram tot Galata-bridge and further is a 5 minutes walk. Buy a jeton at the tramstop for 1, 40 Turkish lira's (around 0,50 â‚¬ cents). Around the hotel are restaurants where you can eat inside as well as outside. Hotel is simple but clean, so are the rooms. Service is friendly. Breakfast is average and is served on the top floor (4). However, no lift is available. The management loves little loose carpets. They are everywhere, also on the stairs! Thanks to the restaurants, you'll need earplugs if you are a light sleeper.

HotelInfo.Name: Atlantis Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Divanyolu Cad. Bicki Yurdu sk. no.12 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
